Incident.Summary: Robert W Brodeur was involved in a single vehicle collision. Brodeur was suspected to be operating the vehicle under the influence of alcohol. DUI Folder# 23-96-175.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
DUI Folder # 23-96-175
SUSPECT: Robert W Broudeur
LICENSE # FL/ ID #B-636-779-71-289-0
DUI CITATION # N/A
SUBSEQUENT OFFENDER: Yes
ACCIDENT INVOLVED: Yes
VIDEO: Maryland State Police; Axon Evidence Video ID #: 23MSP022064. BWC Utilized.
 
TRAINING/CERTIFICATES:
  • I am trained in administering standardized field sobriety tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).
  • I have successfully completed Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (ARIDE) training as of 2021.
  • I am trained and certified to operate RADAR and LIDAR through the Maryland State Police as of 2020.
  • I have apprehended more than 80 impaired drivers during my tenure with the Maryland State Police to date.
 
 
NARRATIVE: 
VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1):
On June 20, 2023 at approximately 0246 hours, I TFC Pinto #7212 was responding to the area of Worcester Highway at Johnson Neck Road, Pocomoke, Worcester County, Maryland for the report of a motor vehicle collision into a tree.

While en route, Worcester County Deputies Parr and Buffa arrived on the scene and reported that the driver of the vehicle was partially ejected from the vehicle and had life threatening injuries. Maryland State Police Aviation was requested and Trooper Revel was requested for accident reconstruction.

Upon my arrival, I observed a blue Nissan Titan collided with a tree located in the median of Worcester Highway at Johnson Neck Road.

 I made contact with Deputy Buffa and he advised that when he arrived on scene that the driver was hanging partially outside of the driver’s side window. Deputy Buffa stated that Pocomoke EMS is going to medivac the driver of the vehicle. Deputy Buffa advised that a tractor trailer driver witnessed the collision and is on scene. After making contact with Deputy Buffa, I made contact with Deputy Parr. Deputy Parr provided the driver of the Nissan Titan Florida Identification card and the driver was identified as Robert W Brodeur (W/M 08/09/1971). Deputy Parr advised Brodeur was being medevaced to the hospital due to his injuries. Deputy Parr stated that Brodeur was partially ejected out of the driver’s side front window when he arrived on scene. Deputy Parr advised that Brodeur’s top half of his body was hanging out of the driver’s side window when he was partially ejected. Deputy Parr stated that Brodeur advised him that his driver’s license was scattered in the Nissan Titan. Deputy Parr stated that the Florida Identification card that he provided me was on Brodeur’s person. Deputy Parr advised that Brodeur stated that his vehicle registration was located in the vehicle.

After making contact with Deputy Parr, I made contact with witness Mary Wayne Coe (W/M 12/21/1968), who was later identified by his North Carolina license. I asked Coe what he observed and he stated in the area of Snow Hill the Nissan Titan passed him. Coe advised when the Nissan Titan passed him he observed it was weaving. Coe stated he caught back up the Nissan Titan when the roadway began to curve multiple times. Coe advised when he caught up to the Nissan Titan it began to speed up after going around the curve. Coe stated the vehicle then went off the roadway into the trees located in the median area of the roadway.
 
PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2): 

Pocomoke Fire/ EMS then made contact with me and advised they located Brodeur’s phone on the ground. I asked if Brodeur was conscious and I was advised that he was conscious and talking.

I responded to the Pocomoke EMS ambulance and provided them wit Brodeur’s phone. While putting Brodeur back in contact with his phone, I looked inside the ambulance and identified that Brodeur was the subject on the  Florida Identification card provided by Deputy Parr. While identifying Brodeur while he was inside the Pocomoke EMS ambulance retrieving medical treatment, I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from the back open door of the ambulance.
Once I walked away from the ambulance, Coe notified me that when he came to a stop he activated the dash cam video on his tractor trailer and recorded the Nissan Titan driving and collision. I asked Coe how I would gain access to the video and he provided the name and number of Sam O’Ham, the regional safety manger of his truck company.

After speaking with Coe, I responded to the Nissan Titan bearing New Hampshire registration, “V45792,” to look for the vehicle registration and Insurance card to complete an accident report. While attempting to locate the registration and insurance card, I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from the passenger compartment of the Nissan Titan. I also observed a Jose Cuervo 1.75L glass tequila bottle located on the back-drivers side passenger seat. When the Jose Cuervo tequila bottle was located it was three-fourths empty (photos attached to this report.)
   
PRE-ARREST SCREENING (PHASE 3):

Due to the extent of Brodeur’s injuries from the vehicle accident, Brodeur was transported, at approximately 0347 hours, to the R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center, located at 22 S Greene Street, Baltimore, Maryland by Maryland State Police Aviation. I was unable to ask Brodeur if he would be willing to perform Standardized Field Sobriety Test due to his injuries.

ARREST:
Based on the totality of circumstances, I had probable cause to believe Brodeur was driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of an alcohol:
       * Due to the motor vehicle accident.
 
        * Brodeur was located in the driver’s seat of the vehicle.
 
        * The odor of an alcoholic beverage coming from Brodeur’s person inside the ambulance.
 
        * The odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from the passenger compartment of the Nissan Titan.
 
         * A 3/4th empty Jose Cuervo Tequila glass bottle was located in the passenger compartment of the vehicle.

I concluded Brodeur was driving under the influence of alcohol and unable to operate a vehicle safely.

At 0347 hours the Maryland State Police Glen Burnie Barrack was contacted, by Sgt Harper, via phone, and requested to provide Brodeur with his DR-15, Advice or Rights, provide him a copy of the DR-15, Advice of Rights to follow along, and offer a blood kit. The Glen Burnie Barrack was asked to contact the Berlin Barrack once the process is completed.

Trooper Litz, assigned to the Glen Burnie Barrack, contacted me via phone, and advised he arrived at the R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center and the medical staff advised him it would be an extended period of time before he was able to see Brodeur due to his injuries. Trooper Litz advised that another trooper, assigned to the Glen Burnie Barrack, working early shift would respond to the Trauma Center and provide Brodeur with his DR-15, Advice or Rights.

At approximately 1200 hours, I contacted the Berlin Barrack via phone and spoke with Corporal Snell and asked if the barrack was contacted by the Glen Burnie Barrack and he advised we were not contacted. Corporal Snell attempted to contact the Glen Burnie Barrack Duty Officer to get an update and he was unavailable.

At approximately 1200 hours, I contacted Trooper Litz, via phone, and asked if anyone responded to the R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center and provided the DR-15, Advice of Rights, and offered a blood kit and he advised he was not notified.

I contacted the Worcester County State's Attorney's Office to Subpoena Brodeur’s blood records.  

On June 27, 2023, I contacted Sam O’Ham, Director, Driver Training & Compliance-Safety for Estes trucking company, via phone, and requested a copy of Coe’s dash cam footage capturing the collision of the blue Nissan Titan. O’Ham advised he would e-mail me a copy of the footage.

On June 28, 2023, I received an e-mail from O’Ham with the dash cam footage from Coe’s tractor trailer attached.

Upon review of the video, you observe the Nissan Titan traveling southbound on Worcester Highway at Johnson Neck Road. The vehicle travels from lane one into the left turn lane. The vehicle travels to the end of the turn lane and the vehicle brakes activate. The vehicle travels off the roadway and struck a tree with the front end of the vehicle. The dash cam footage was uploaded to evidence.com and labeled 23MSP022064.

An ACRS report was generated in reference to the accident scene and completed in Delta +.

I request this case remain open pending the results of the blood records.

All events occurred in Worcester County, Maryland.

On July 26, 2023, at approximately 1346 hours, I, TFC. Pinto #7212 received an e-mail from David Sharpe, the Chief Investigator from the Office of the State's Attorney for Worcester County, with a copy of Brodeur's medical records from the University of Maryland Medical Sytem.  

On page 317 of the medical records, it states upon arrival at  R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center, Brodeur's ethanol level was 234 mg/dL. The conversion to blood alcohol concentration equals .23 grams per 100 ml of blood (To convert ethanol results to "legal" units,  %(W/V) or g/dL).

On August 07, 2023, Brodeur was charged with driving under the influence of alcohol. The traffic citations were certified mailed to Brodeur's residence located in Florida. 

On August 08, 0223, I contacted Brodeur, via phone, and advised him of his charges. Once advised of his charges, Brodeur stated that he was hit by a red truck. I advised Brodeur that dash cam video of the collision did not show a red struck collide with him. Brodeur asked what evidence I had to charge him with driving under the influence of alcohol and I advised Brodeur that I detected the odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from his vehicle and his person when he was inside the ambulance on the scene of the collision. Brodeur was advised that he will receive his traffic citations in the mail. I asked Broadeur if his Milton, Florida address was a good address to mail the citations, and he stated it was. Brodeur then requested that I also mail the citations to1002 Alexandria Drive, Pensacola, Florida 32505. Broadeur was advised that he will receive a court date in the mail. 

A MSP Form 67, Chain of Custody/Lab was completed and attached to the Medical Records. The Medical Records  and the MSP form 67 were stored in Maryland State Police Barrack "V"  storage. MSP Form 67 is attached to this report.

Charges:
  •  Driving Under the Influence of Alcohol (3QX0VPH)
  • Driving While Impaired by Alcohol (3QY0VPH)
  • Negligent Driving (3QZ0VPH)
  • Reckless Driving (3R00VPH)
  • Driver Failure to Obey a Properly Placed Traffic Control Device (3R10VPH)
  • Failure to Control Vehicle Speed on Highway to Avoid Collision (3R20VPH)
Case Closed by arrest.

All events occurred in Worcester County.

Maryland State Police
Princess Anne Barrack “X”
Tpr. J. D. Revel III, IBM 7146
Field Operations Bureau
June 20th, 2023

MSP Patrol Vehicle: X-11 is a maroon unmarked 2021 Ford Explorer equipped with MVR system.
Type of Report: Collision Investigation
Agency Case #: 23-MSP-022064

Driver/Suspect: Robert W. Brodeur
Date of Birth: 8/9/1971
Driver’s License Information: B636779712890 FL Class D

This report has been prepared based upon the observations of this trooper and/or those of other troopers relative to the offense(s). The facts contained herein are intended solely to give the prosecuting authority a basic understanding of the facts pertaining to this case. The facts contained herein are not intended to be an exhaustive recitation of the facts pertaining to pretrial or trial issues. Instead, this trooper anticipates that during the pretrial proceedings in this case, the prosecutor will take the opportunity to interview this trooper in order to ascertain any and all relevant facts which might be the subject of this troopers' testimony during court proceedings.

Section I – Narrative
            On June 20th, 2023, at approximately 0246 hours, Troopers from the Maryland State Police Berlin Barrack responded to southbound U.S. Route 113 at Johnson Neck Road in Pocomoke City, Worcester County, Maryland, to investigate a single-vehicle collision with partial ejection. Upon arrival, Troopers found that the collision involved a 2005 Nissan Titan bearing New Hampshire registration V45792. The driver, Robert W. Brodeur, was found in the driver’s seat of the Titan. He was partially ejected out of the driver’s side window with serious injury.

            Brodeur was transported to R. Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center in Baltimore by Maryland State Police Aviation Trooper 4 with serious injuries. Due to the nature of the collision, a request was made for a Maryland State Police Collision Reconstruction Specialist to respond. I answered the call at 0301 hours and arrived at approximately 0308 hours. Upon my arrival, I spoke to TFC Pinto who updated me on the collision. TFC Pinto advised that he would be speaking with witnesses and completing the ACRS while I gathered the physical evidence at the scene.

            I began processing the scene by taking digital photographs of the Titan. The Titan had sustained extensive damage to the front section resulting from the collision. The front of the Titan and displayed minor crush damage, dents, and missing pieces from contact with a tree. The front quarter panels of both sides of the truck had also sustained crush damage and buckling. The windshield was shattered but still maintained within the frame. The front bumper and engine compartment had wrapped around the tree at the front. The roof of the Titan had also buckled downwards from the force of the collision. The left front tire had also separated from the wheel. There was minor damage to the left rear quarter panel of the Titan. Both doors on the right side of the Titan were partially removed and damaged by emergency medical personnel attempting to extract Brodeur. In plain view on the back seat behind the driver, there was an open and nearly empty 1.75L bottle of Jose Cuervo.

            During the investigation I conducted a follow-up with R. Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center. Hospital staff advised that Brodeur had survived the collision and had suffered no life-threatening or life-altering injuries.

Section II – Attachments
The following items are attached to this report:
  1. ACRS Report
  2. Arial Photo of the Scene
Conclusion
            On June 20th, 2023, at approximately 0246 hours, Troopers from the Maryland State Police Berlin Barrack responded to southbound U.S. Route 113 at Johnson Neck Road in Pocomoke City, Worcester County, Maryland, to investigate a single-vehicle collision with partial ejection. The collision involved a 2005 Nissan Titan bearing New Hampshire registration V45792.

            Investigation revealed that Mr. Brodeur was operating the Titan and was initially traveling south on U.S. Route 113 approaching Johnson Neck Road. For an unknown reason, the Titan drove off of the roadway to the left and struck a tree where it came to final rest facing south. Mr. Brodeur was partially ejected and was not wearing a seatbelt at the time of the collision. A witness who observed the crash advised in his statement that the Titan was being operated at a high rate of speed and was swerving into other lanes of travel. Due to witness statements, opinion of the medical staff, and evidence found at the scene, it is believed that Brodeur’s recklessness was exacerbated by the consumption of alcohol. Video was obtained of the collision and attached to the report by TFC Pinto.

            Mr. Brodeur sustained serious injuries resulting from the collision and was transported to R. Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center in Baltimore via Maryland State Police Aviation Trooper 4. At the time of this report, nurses at Shock Trauma have advised that he is in stable condition. The Titan was towed from the scene by East Street towing and was not stored.

            Since Brodeur did not suffer any life-threatening or life-altering injuries from the collision, it was determined that there was no need for a detailed investigation. The investigation was turned over to TFC Pinto to issue the appropriate citations and charges related to the collision.
This concludes my involvement with the case.

Authored by:
John D. Revel III, #7146
Trooper First Class
Maryland Department of State Police
Princess Anne Barrack “X"
30581 Perry Road
